description: flock of sheep center foreground; two seated figures lower left; ruins on right and debris in field with sheep; town left distance; trees left above figures
inscription:
Signature, and Inscription

in plate below image in black: [A. Meyeringh Inv: et fec:  7-62 (in pencil)];  on mount in black: [(P)late 2./ Albert Meyeringh (son of Frederick Meyerlingh) born at Amsterdam 1645/ pupil of his father who was a painter of screens & ornaments/ Sent by him Early to Rome where he met John Glauber his/ country man - who\'s style he adopted.  His subjects consist of Ruins/ of ancient architecture with figures in the style of/ Gerard Laurisse.  He died at Amsterdam in 1714 aged 69./ He etched Landscapes in a painter like style from his/ own designs.]; on verso in pencil: [B V 351/H.XIV]; Upper right corner of mount in pencil:[0002(?)  11]
title: The Flock
